title: 112_s3539
content: The Act is known as the "Medicaid Information Technology to Enhance Community Health Act of 2012" or the "MITECH Act." It provides incentives for the adoption and use of EHR technology by safety net clinics and providers. Section 1903(t) of the Social Security Act is amended to include QSNC-based practitioners in certain clauses related to healthcare settings. The amendment to Section 1903(t) of the Social Security Act includes QSNC-based practitioners in specific clauses related to healthcare settings, such as Federally qualified health centers, rural health clinics, and qualified safety net clinics. The term 'qualified safety net clinic' refers to a clinic operated by a non-profit or public entity with at least 30% of patient volume from needy individuals. 'QSNC-based' pertains to professionals providing services in such clinics. The determination of whether an eligible professional is a QSNC-based eligible professional shall be made based on the site of service, without considering any employment or billing arrangement. For Medicaid providers in qualified safety net clinics, the Secretary will establish a payment methodology. The Secretary will establish a methodology for determining payment amounts for qualified safety net clinics. By January 1, 2015, regulations will be promulgated for clinics to demonstrate meaningful use of EHR technology. Clinics must follow this procedure to be eligible for payments. The Secretary will establish a methodology for determining payment amounts for qualified safety net clinics. Eligible professionals in these clinics may choose to receive payments in lieu of payments from the Secretary. If the clinic receives payments, professionals in the clinic will not be eligible for Secretary payments.
